spellcheck.spell

Class Checker

  • java.lang.Object
    • spellcheck.spell.Checker

  • public class Checker
extends java.lang.Object
    A spell checker maintains a dictionary of words that are read in from a text file. It also tracks the frequency of each word as observed in some corpus of literature, which is also read in from a text file. Given some string, the spell checker can search through its dictionary for similar words and return a list of suggested spelling corrections. The corrections are ranked in order their relevance.
    Author:
    Your Name

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_EDIT_DISTANCE
      When searching for suggestions, the spell checker will only consider words which are this far away from the given string in terms of Levenshtein distance.

      Checker(java.io.File dictionary, java.io.File corpus)
      Creates a spell checker which recognizes all the words in the dictionary file as correctly spelled words and which counts the frequency of those words in the given corpus file.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_EDIT_DISTANCE

        public static final int MAX_EDIT_DISTANCE
        When searching for suggestions, the spell checker will only consider words which are this far away from the given string in terms of Levenshtein distance.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checker

        public Checker()
        Creates a spell checker with no words in the dictionary.

      • Checker

        public Checker(java.io.File dictionary,
       java.io.File corpus)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a spell checker which recognizes all the words in the dictionary file as correctly spelled words and which counts the frequency of those words in the given corpus file. Both files should be plain text with words separated by one or more whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - a file of words which are correctly spelled
        corpus - a file of common literature from which frequency counts will be derived
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if either file is not found

    • Method Detail

      • addWord

        public void addWord(java.lang.String word)
        Adds a word to the dictionary of correctly spelled words. If the word is already in this dictionary, nothing changes (including the frequency count of that word). Newly added words have a frequency of 1.
        Parameters:
        word - the new word to be added

      • isWord

        public boolean isWord(java.lang.String word)
        Checks whether or not a given word is part of this dictionary.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to check
        Returns:
        true if the word is in this dictionary, false otherwise

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency(java.lang.String word)
        Returns the frequency of a given word as it was observed in the corpus used to initialize this spell checker.
        Parameters:
        word - the word for which the frequency will be checked
        Returns:
        the frequency of the word in the corpus
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the word is not in this dictionary

      • increaseFrequency

        public void increaseFrequency(java.lang.String word)
        Increments the frequency of the given word by 1.
        Parameters:
        word - the word whose frequency will be incremented
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the word is not in this dictionary

      • getSuggestions

        public Suggestion[] getSuggestions(java.lang.String string)
        Given some string, this method returns a list of Suggestions for correctly spelled words that are similar to the string. The list of suggestions is sorted according to three criteria:
        • Suggestions with lower edit distance appear first.
        • Between suggestions with the same edit distance, suggestions with higher frequency counts appear first.
        • Between suggestions with the same frequency counts, suggestions first in alphabetical order appear first.
        The list of suggestions will include all words which are MAX_EDIT_DISTANCE edit distance away from the given string. If the given string is a correctly spelled word, the first suggestion will be the word itself.
        Parameters:
        string - the string for which suggestions will be returned
        Returns:
        a list of suggestions sorted by how likely they are to be the intended correct spelling
